fact: Tea is world's second most popular beverage after water.
Boston Tea Party: Taxed tea led to harbor rebellion.
Da Hong Pao: World's priciest tea, costs thousands.
Tea bags invented accidentally in 1908 by tea importer.
The word 'tea' is nearly universal in languages.
Tea serves as a natural fabric dye too.
Tea bag revolutionized how Americans prepare tea.
World's longest tea bag measured over 900 feet.
Russian tea tradition: serve with jam or lemon.
Tea can clean and shine your wooden furniture.
Tea: Turning water into a socially acceptable hug since forever.
Tea bags: The real MVPs of lazy steeping moments.
Tea parties: Because adulting can be pretend too.
Tea spills: Nature's way of testing your carpet's absorbency.
Tea bags' secret talent: Impromptu puppet shows for mugs.
Tea ceremonies: Pretending to be fancy, one sip at a time.
Tea stains: Artistic expressions on every forgotten coaster.
Tea bags' dream job: Traveling the world, one hot tub at a time.
Tea wisdom: Life is short, steep your moments well.
Tea enthusiasts: Water whisperers and herbal sorcerers.
